        Constructor
        Parameters:
        mainImage - - ImageEntity background
        secondary - - ImageEntity load game background
        titleArrow - - AnimatedSprite for currently selected option
        screenWidth - - width of the window in pixels
        screenHeight - - height of the window in pixels
        simple - - The font to use for normal text
        bold - - The font to use for bold text
        bigBold - - The font to use for big loud remarks, very bold

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                   java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                   int titleX,
                   int titleY,
                   int titleX2,
                   int titleY2)
        Render the title screen and change what is being shown based on options the user chooses
        Parameters:
        frame - - JFrame window where the images will be rendered
        g2d - - Graphics2D object needed to render images
        titleX - - x position of the arrow
        titleY - - y position of the arrow
        titleX2 - - x position of the arrow once a choice is made
        titleY2 - - y position of the arrow once a choice has been made

      • update

        public void update(OPTION option,
                   int location)
        Update the title screen variables from outside of this class
        Parameters:
        option - - The new currently selected option
        location - - The file which the arrow is pointing to

      • setFileName

        public void setFileName(char currentChar)
        This method updates the current filename variable and sorts out any non valid characters. This also makes sure the the file name is always 10 characters or less. This method is best used when checking for whatever the user is currently pressing on the keyboard, then converting that keycode in to a char and passing that in to this method.
        Parameters:
        currentChar - - The character to be checked and added in to the file name

      • deleteChar

        public void deleteChar()
        Method used to delete the last character when typing a file name (Backspace)

      • enter

        public java.lang.String enter()
        Method which decides what happens when the enter key is pressed, what happens depends on many different variables. This method also returns the filename if it is over one, for loading purposes.
        Returns:
        - Either an empty string or the filename being chosen

      • getFileName

        public java.lang.String getFileName()

      • files

        public java.lang.String[] files()
